revised_title: Tide Observations and Their Implications on Tidal Phenomena
tldr: The author discusses the results of tide observations made in June 1834 at various Coast Guard stations in Great Britain and Ireland. The observations were conducted to better understand tidal phenomena and improve tidal predictions. The author concludes that while there are local irregularities, there are no general irregularities affecting tides along extensive coastlines, which could aid in making more accurate tidal predictions.
